name: 人力資源招募與甄選研究
goals: Demonstrate an understanding of HR recruiting and selection concepts.
List the strategic and planning issues of employee staffing.
Explain the importance of job descriptions and job specifications.
Devise a plan to recruit needed employees using appropriate recruitment channel.
Report and discuss legal and ethical dilemmas as they emerge during the process.
syllabus:
16+2 weeks: The first sixteen weeks will instruct the concepts and knowledge from various sources (e.g., textbook, journal articles, casebook, and etc.) and the last two weeks will conduct critical analysis and reflection on various practical cases related to the content of the first sixteen weeks

methodologies.note: Text book, PowerPoint slides and video clips will be used to introduce the topics relevant to HR recruitment and selection
Students will be divided into groups. Each group will discuss assigned cases derived from Tanglewood casebook and present their answers to the whole class for class discussion.
Students will collaborate on a group project to analyze respectively assigned cases from Tanglewood casebook.

grading.note: At the end of the semester, a final exam will be given to evaluate students’ comprehension of the course materials. The test format will include multiple choice and short essay questions.
Students are expected to attend each class, prepare discussed readings and assignments and actively participate in class discussions.
Class attendance is required. Please come to the class on time and notify the instructor ahead of time if you will be late or absent for a class.
Cases will be assigned as a group project. Each group will present an integrating case and their answers to case questions in class.

Students will complete cases chosen from Tanglewood project. First, all groups will write “briefer” memos for Cases 1 and 2.  Then, all groups will do longer memos for Case 3, 4 and 6.  These memos should be at least three pages in length, and should answer all questions raised in the case instructions. The grade for this project depends on the in-class presentation and the written report.

prerequisite: ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
